Pizza. One of the most loved foods in America. But which is the best? Is it Pizza Hut, Papa Johns, Dominoes, Little Caesars, Hungry Howies...? What is your favorite pizza place and why. 
 
 
 I personally like The Loop, a small chain of brick-oven pizza places. And I like joesph's pizza. I have to say that the franchise pizza places aren't usually as good as some gourmet pizza place you find down the street. And if gourmet pizzas are too expensive for you, I like making my own. I use Beer-Lovers Deep Dish recipe...(there's beer in the crust)
Gus' New York Pizza near Arizona State University

Pizza Hut 
 Chesse
 Just plain cheese.
Mellow Mushroom! Much better than any of the other pizza places I've tried and BELIEVE me, I LOVE pizza and take my pizza eating very seriously. emoticon_xagree
Papa John's is good so is Pizza Pit.... PIzza huts good but i get sick and gag on like my third peice....overshare...but o well
Little Caesars is my favorite :) Good pizza and very good prices
Anthony's for those who are military related... very good... love the bacon cheeseburger pizza(odd name but good taste)

Happy Joe's
 particularly meatworks
 
 anyone who's had it will agree hands down

I'm not American so I don't know those stores. But if you ever want to take a chance and order a custom made pizza, I can help you out.
 
 It's a toss up between:
 
 Thick pan fried crust, with a bbq sauce base. Add cheese, bacon, onion, mushroom, capsicum, and chicken. Trust me.
 
 Or:
 
 Thick pan fried crust with embedded herbs - basil, oregano and garlic. The base is plain tomato sauce, and the toppings are plain ham and cheese, or pepperoni and cheese. You just need one meat and some cheese, basically. Trust me again.

Here in denver there's this little hole in the wall pizzeria called Nicolo's
 
 They make the best pizza ever
 
 Even better calzones
 
 
 The best pizza combination is italian sausage and banana peppers

Anthony's for those who are military related... very good... love the bacon cheeseburger pizza(odd name but good taste)

 
 would have to agree w/ that. anthonys is the best pizza on a military instalation. (they even have Anthony's in a base in Germany lol)
 
 off base i would say a small chain called Steve's Pizza
Papa John's is my fav, not only is there pizza great, There cheese sticks are to die for!! WOOT! emoticon_xhoho
I like Pizza Hut. I've heard Papa John's is gross, at least the one in Saskatoon, Saskcatchewan (catchy, huh?). Back in my home town (pop. 2500!) we've got a great place called Pizzeria Piccolo's.

[QUOTE=about0everythin]Pizza. One of the most loved foods in America. But which is the best? Is it Pizza Hut, Papa Johns, Dominoes, Little Caesars, Hungry Howies...? 
 
 
 I have lived in many cities (but not many states, or countries). One thing I have noticed is that the pizza is different even from the same corporation. Where I grew up my favorite was Hungry Howies, where I am now its Domino's, where I lived in between it was Papa John's; despite availabilty of all places in all locations. Though Domino's is my favorite, I eat more Tony's than any other. Why you ask? Because its $0.98 at Wal-Mart and that is all the collegian funds I can afford toward the finer things in life!

[QUOTE=diabloespecial]
Pizza. One of the most loved foods in America. But which is the best? Is it Pizza Hut, Papa Johns, Dominoes, Little Caesars, Hungry Howies...? 
 
 
 I have lived in many cities (but not many states, or countries). One thing I have noticed is that the pizza is different even from the same corporation. Where I grew up my favorite was Hungry Howies, where I am now its Domino's, where I lived in between it was Papa John's; despite availabilty of all places in all locations. Though Domino's is my favorite, I eat more Tony's than any other. Why you ask? Because its $0.98 at Wal-Mart and that is all the collegian funds I can afford toward the finer things in life!

 
 
 I'm sorry, but I had to register and post on this thread because you are all so lost. 
 
 Just go here
 http://pizzatherapy.com/pepe's_quotes.htm
 
 I feel bad for any of you who don't have access to pizza. Pizza Hut, Papa Johns, all of those places don't make pizza. They make garbage and try to pass it off as pizza.
 Good luck to all of you. I won't be posting here again. I don't even know what this forum is about. 
 My hope for all of you is that you get to eat real pizza someday.

Pinnapple Pizza! mmm...
 or papa johns cuz they ot that garlic sauce for the crust!

Sbarros and Papa Dels

 OMG CRIM!?!?!?!?!? We are from Illinois,(((chicago))) and all you said was Papa Dels and Sbarros? emoticon_ic This is a sad day, and I am not proud of my fellow Illinois people ::sob sob:: PALERMOS!! VILLA ROSA!! (i think that's how ya spell em.) But what kind of pizza.... mmmmmm pizzaaaa **drools like homer** uh... I'm a fatty :p hehe.. black olive, bacon, and green peppers. Atleast I get my greens~ emoticon_xhoho

I'd have to say Everybodys pizza and Mellow Mushroom! *~YUM~*
 hmmm... as of toppings, I would have to say black olives and mushrooms. emoticon_xlove

[QUOTE=diabloespecial;29353]
Pizza. One of the most loved foods in America. But which is the best? Is it Pizza Hut, Papa Johns, Dominoes, Little Caesars, Hungry Howies...? 
 
 
 I have lived in many cities (but not many states, or countries). One thing I have noticed is that the pizza is different even from the same corporation. Where I grew up my favorite was Hungry Howies, where I am now its Domino's, where I lived in between it was Papa John's; despite availabilty of all places in all locations. Though Domino's is my favorite, I eat more Tony's than any other. Why you ask? Because its $0.98 at Wal-Mart and that is all the collegian funds I can afford toward the finer things in life!

 
 I have to agree big time that the taste varies from the same store chain, depending on where you are. I loved Domino's pizza when I was going to college in Plattsburgh, NY. Pizza was good from all the mom and pop stores in the New York City suburbs where I grew up so we had no need for the chain stores there. I now live in St Petersburg Florida and Domino's, Hungry Howie's, Pizza Hut etc. pizza all make me want to throw up. It just tastes god awful! It tastes like they dumped raw tomato sauce on top and heated it (never cooked the sauce). I just gave up eating pizza completely because it was awful everywhere here in Florida. Now a place called 'Mario's Pizza' opened near my house and it actually tastes like pizza did back in NY (or at least very close).

Pizza. One of the most loved foods in America. But which is the best? Is it Pizza Hut, Papa Johns, Dominoes, Little Caesars, Hungry Howies...? What is your favorite pizza place and why. 
 
 
 I personally like The Loop, a small chain of brick-oven pizza places. And I like joesph's pizza. I have to say that the franchise pizza places aren't usually as good as some gourmet pizza place you find down the street. And if gourmet pizzas are too expensive for you, I like making my own. I use Beer-Lovers Deep Dish recipe...(there's beer in the crust)

 
 I like my local pizza and kebab place "the speedy pepper" which does lovely pizzas but my fave from there is their house special, chicken, sweetcorn, ham, pinapples, peppers,onions,cheese.yummy!!

I can't eat pizza for health problems (since November '04). But when I could eat pizza, it was predominately Pizza Hut Stuffed Crust Pizza with extra cheese (or as much as 4-cheese).
 But I never cared for Pappa John's. They were always really nasty IMO.

I personally like Papa John's, and Pizza Hut for major pizza chains. Another, smaller pizza chain that I like better than those two is Rocky Rococo's, which is a chain centered in Wisconsin (although there are some around the coutnry - one in Washington, one in Kentucky, and I think one in Florida).
 
 However, if any of you ever get the chance to visit Golden, Colorado (Maybe for the Coors brewery tour :) ), go to Downtown Golden on Washington Street - the main street through Golden - and eat at Woody's Woodfired Pizza. BEST PIZZA EVER.

The best pizza I ever had was in Minnesota, a place called Sven and Ollies. Not only was there pizza excellent, it was the size of a trash can lid (with thick crust, the right way to eat it) for the price of a chain medium!
 
 My favorite chain pizza place has gotta be Papa Johns. I don't even have to defend it, the pizza does that for me.
 
 Out of the box, I like Red Baron's. Don't know why, just think it's really good.

Little family owned joint at the corner of Fisk Ave. and Dobson St. in Philadelphia named Frank's run by the Straface family. Best Pizza I have ever had in my life. Everyone talks about NY pizza and Chicago pizza, but Philly has a style all it's own. Almost as good is another little Greek pizza shop on Conrad St. close to my house called Apollos. Extra sauce, extra cheese. I have not eaten chain store pizza in years, and I do not miss them.

Rosa's Downtown Atlanta
 Bambinelli's Northlake
 Mellow Mushroom anywhere
 Olympia Stockbridge
The kind that still tastes good the next morning for breakfast.

It's interesting, here in Aus we have Pizza Hut and Dominoes, not sure if there are any Papa Johns etc. I wonder if they taste the same, aside from regional variations in fruit/vegetable/meat quality.
 
 Over here, Pizza Hut is the brand of the money-conscious. A large pizza, which will generally feed 2 people or 1 hungry teenager, can often be had for $5 AUS, which is about $4 US. Their pepperoni pizza has 8 slices of pepperoni, and their quality is both low and highly variable.
 
 I'm much more a fan of Dominoes, costs about twice as much, but its quality approaches that of "real" pizza places, and I will gladly eat it.
 
 
 
 One thing I both love and hate about the US, and I haven't often been there, is the size of portions. I mean when you order ribs, you got so many ribs you can barely eat them all. And after your meal you have to sleep. Which is fantastic for a holiday, when you want to stuff yourself, but I can't imagine eating like that all the time.
